definition: leave-taking/to say goodbye

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
surname Bie
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in
to make sb change their ways, opinions etc

sentences.english: I thanked Hannah and said goodbye.
A shake hands as you say good-bye and thank the interviewer for spending time with you.
sentences.chinese: 道别时要握手感谢雇主花时间面试你。

sentences.english: The British had departed New York, and the general bade farewell to his men.
sentences.chinese: 当时，英军已撤离纽约，将军也与部下道别。

sentences.english: I see you've come to say your goodbyes.
sentences.chinese: 我不擅长道别，我会打电话给你。

sentences.english: Usually they do not shake hands when they just meet or say goodbye.
sentences.chinese: 如果只是遇见或是道别时，通常他们是不会握手的。

sentences.english: Mother and Sue kissed Gretel goodbye.
sentences.chinese: 母亲和苏与格莱托亲吻道别。

sentences.english: Then he said he had an appointment and had to go, so we shook hands and said goodbye.
sentences.chinese: 后来他说他还有个约会必须走了，我们握手道别。

sentences.english: After the movie was finished, James said good-bye to his friends and walked home alone.
sentences.chinese: 电影结束后，詹姆斯跟朋友道别，然后独自走回家。

sentences.english: He tore off before we said goodbye to him.
sentences.chinese: 我们还没来得及向他道别他就匆匆走了。

sentences.english: No awkward goodbyes, no "still friends" bullshit.
sentences.chinese: 没有尴尬的道别，没有“还是朋友”的废话。

sentences.english: She fluttered her handkerchief from the train window as a goodbye.
sentences.chinese: 她在火车的窗口挥动着手绢道别。

sentences.english: She fought back her tears as she said goodby.
sentences.chinese: 她在道别时强忍住没有哭出来。

sentences.english: Whenthe employee leaves your office after a long talk stand up to say good- bye.
sentences.chinese: 当雇员和你长谈之后要离开你办公室时，起身道别。

sentences.english: You will obey man, and man and say goodbye.
sentences.chinese: 你顺从了男人的意愿，于是和男人道别。

sentences.english: She will then say goodbye to the Prince Charming in her dream and continue to grow up.
sentences.chinese: 于是她会道别梦中的白马王子，重新踏上人生旅程。

sentences.english: I said good-bye to the well and began to walk back down.
sentences.chinese: 我对泉井道别，往回走去。

definition: to take one's leave/to bid farewell
reluctant to part (idiom); broken-hearted at having to leave
to take leave
to leave/to bid farewell to/to say good-bye to
hurriedly
to leave/to exit
to say goodbye/to take one's leave
to say hello to/to send one's regards to
to exchange conventional greetings/to talk about the weather
to express thanks
to greet sb by word or action/to give prior notice
goodbye/see you again later
on parting/facing separation
reluctant to part
to follow with one's eyes (a departing guest etc)
to see someone off/to throw someone a send-off party
